Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

resource.description: Schema for AWS::CodeStarConnections::Connection resource which can be used to connect external source providers with AWS CodePipeline

properties.name: ConnectionName
properties.description: The name of the connection. Connection names must be unique in an AWS user account.

type.description: The name of the connection. Connection names must be unique in an AWS user account.

properties.name: ProviderType
properties.description: The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.

type.description: The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.

properties.name: HostArn
properties.description: The host arn configured to represent the infrastructure where your third-party provider is installed. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.

type.description: The host arn configured to represent the infrastructure where your third-party provider is installed. You must specify either a ProviderType or a HostArn.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: Specifies the tags applied to a connection.

type.description: Specifies the tags applied to a connection.

attributes.description: Schema for AWS::CodeStarConnections::Connection resource which can be used to connect external source providers with AWS CodePipeline

properties.name: ConnectionArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the  connection. The ARN is used as the connection reference when the connection is shared between AWS services.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the  connection. The ARN is used as the connection reference when the connection is shared between AWS services.

properties.name: ConnectionStatus
properties.description: The current status of the connection.

type.description: The current status of the connection.

properties.name: OwnerAccountId
properties.description: The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. For Bitbucket, this is the account ID of the owner of the Bitbucket repository.

type.description: The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. For Bitbucket, this is the account ID of the owner of the Bitbucket repository.
